title: Review & setlist: John Fogerty shows perseverance at MGM Music Hall
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Concert Reviews The 80-year-old Rock And Roll Hall Of Famer played with energy and excitement, as if he was riding a high that had been far too long in coming.
John Fogerty brought his "Celebration Tour" to Boston on Friday.
Mike Morgan / Ripe Melon Photography By Marc Hirsh November 15, 2025 | 1:29 PM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Patriots reportedly could be without key defensive standout Milton Williams for a couple of games
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Williams suffered the injury in the first quarter of the Patriots' win over the Jets on Thursday.
Milton Williams has been one of the top players on the Patriots' defense this season.

(AP Photo/Vera Nieuwenhuis) By Conor Roche November 15, 2025 | 12:47 PM 2 minutes to read Milton Williams thought he could play the entirety of the Patriots’ win over the Jets after injuring his ankle on Thursday.

title: Television ratings rise right along with Patriots during stunning season of rejuvenation
author: Chad Finn
bullets: New England Patriots Patriots broadcasts on CBS are averaging a 24.
4 household rating and 72 share in the Boston market.
That’s up 23 percent from last season.

title: A workmanlike yet spectacular victory by the Patriots to keep the NFL’s best winning streak alive
author: Chad Finn
bullets: New England Patriots There was plenty of fabulous play by the hosts to be found in a game that never really felt in danger of being anything other than a Patriots victory.
Patriots lineman Christian Barmore sacks Jets quarterback Justin Fields in the fourth quarter of Thursday's win.
Matthew J.

title: Cam Newton believes Patriots have ‘fool’s gold written all over them’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots "If you keep playing sorry scrubs, then you're going to have this falsetto of a mentality going into the playoffs.
" Mike Vrabel has helped the Patriots get out to a 9-2 start.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Roche November 15, 2025 | 12:06 PM 2 minutes to read Cam Newton isn’t buying into the Patriots just yet.

title: Red Sox reportedly expected to spend into luxury tax this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox were also a luxury tax team in 2025.
Craig Breslow and John Henry will likely have to spend into the luxury tax to help improve the Red Sox' roster this offseason.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Roche November 15, 2025 | 11:21 AM 2 minutes to read If the Red Sox want to improve off of their first postseason appearance in four years, they’re going to have to spend.

title: What to know about the new intercity bus terminal at South Station
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The new bus terminal will boost capacity by more than 50 percent and offer smoother connections to trains and the subway.
A traveler heads for the gates at the South Station Bus Terminal’s main entrance.

Stan Grossfeld/Boston Globe Staff After five years of planning and construction, the MBTA has opened a major expansion of the South Station Bus Terminal, unveiling a new intercity bus concourse that adds 12 more docks.

title: Expanded Logan Express location opens in Framingham
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Travelers can now look forward to faster airport shuttle service and more parking spots.
The revamped Framingham Logan Express has reopened, offering expanded parking and faster shuttle service to travelers heading to Logan International Airport.
On Thursday, the Massachusetts Port Authority (Massport), which operates Logan Airport, unveiled the rebuilt facility at 11 Burr St.

title: ‘You know you have the face of the franchise’: David Ortiz thoroughly impressed with Roman Anthony’s rookie season
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Boston Red Sox “A guy like him, you know your money is worth it.
” Roman Anthony’s rookie season started late and was cut short by an oblique injury, but Red Sox legend David Ortiz loved what he saw from the 21-year-old.
AP Photo/Stephanie Scarbrough By Kaley Brown November 15, 2025 | 7:59 AM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: ‘New England is at the center of it’: Ken Burns talks ‘The American Revolution’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Entertainment The epic story, with Boston as an epicenter, premieres Nov.
16 on PBS.
Cinematographer Buddy Squires shoots on-location at Monmouth Battlefield State Park.
